fullText: Theater ‘The Outsiders’ stays gold as a truly great new American musical (Broadway review) Emma Pittman and Brody Grant in 'The Outsiders' (Photo: Matthew Murphy) Date: April 11, 2024 Author: Thom Geier 3 Comments The Outsiders sparkles not just as a smart adaptation of the beloved S.E. Hinton novel (and Francis Ford Coppola movie) but a genuinely great American musical. The songs here, by the indie folk duo Jamestown Revival (with Justin Levine) donâ€™t feel like pro forma music breaks but organic engines driving a tragic story of class conflict and brotherly love to onstage moments with real heft. Plus, the score boasts a country-inflected energy and lyrics that match the plainspoken poetry of Robert Frost. Who says that nothing gold can stay? You can read my full review in the June/July issue of Musicals magazine .
